title: Uruguay - Conflict Data
org: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED)

bites.title: Map of locations
bite: On 6 December 2020, in Montevideo (Montevideo), thousands of Uruguayans marched towards La Teja cemetery to honor and say goodbye to former President Tabare Vazquez (Broad Front), who had just died of a lung cancer. [size=thousands]
COFE: Confederation of State Employees' Organizations; Labour Group (Uruguay)

On 27 November 2020, in San Carlos (Maldonado), dozens of civil servants and COFE (Confederation of State Employees' Organizations) members protested during President Lacalle Pou's visit to the city, to demand the inclusion of their salary adjustment on the 4th article of the Budget bill. The group also complained about the impossibility of the General Management of the State Casino's workers to go back to work, due to the concessionaire company giving up on continuing its activities. Near them, 125 unemployed construction workers protested for unknown reasons. [size=more than 125]

On 4 November 2020, in Montevideo-Municipio B, (Montevideo state), a protest was held in front of the Executive Power, urging President Lacalle Pou to ensure schools provide the necessary protection measures as students are taking in-person classes in the midst of the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]
PIT-CNT: Intersindical Workers' Plenary - National Workers' Convention; Labour Group (Uruguay); Students (Uruguay)

On 28 October 2020, in Montevideo-Municipio B (Montevideo), students, members of PIT-CNT (Intersindical Workers' Plenary - National Workers' Convention), judicial workers and other unions marched from the University of the Republic (UdelaR) towards the Parliament to repudiate the Urgent Consideration Bill (LUC), the 2021 budget, the government's financial readjustment, salary cut, outsourcings and privatizations. [size=no report]

On 8 October 2020, in Salto (Salto), students marched through the city center to complain about the budget for the 2020-2024 period, proposed by the Executive Branch. The group claimed that it would affect several courses and threaten the decentralization of university education in the country. [size=no report]

On 1 October 2020, in Montevideo-Municipio B (Montevideo), workers of the Ministry of Social Development (Mides) gathered in front of it and blocked Avenue 18 de Julio in a protest to demand the payment of their unpaid wages and the regularization of 150 workers. [size=no report]

On 25 September 2020, in Montevideo-Municipio Ch (Montevideo), a group, that included health workers, protested against the budget cuts in education, science and in Dr. Manuel Quintela Hospital. The group surrounded President Lacalle Pou with posters. [size=no report]

On 25 September 2020, in Montevideo-Municipio B (Montevideo), thousands of LGBT people gathered in Libertad Square and carried out the Diversity March to demand and support their rights. [size=thousands]

On 21 September 2020, in Montevideo-Municipio B (Montevideo), around 200 supporters of Penarol soccer team protested in front of its headquarters to express their dissatisfaction with the team's performance and its authorities. [size=around 200]
On 18 September 2020, in Salto (Salto), the 10th Diversity March took place in Uruguay street, to support and ensure LGBT rights. [size=no report]

On 17 September 2020, in Salto (Salto), workers of different unions gathered in Artigas Square to march in reject to the decrease of the national budget to health and education and support the 24-hour national strike convened by PIT-CNT (Intersindical Workers' Plenary - National Workers' Convention). [size=no report]

On 16 September 2020, in Montevideo-Municipio F (Montevideo), a bomb was thrown at Nunez transportation company and a flyer written 'Nunez bloodsucker' was found around. There was no information about the perpetrators and its motivations.

On 25 August 2020, in Florida (Florida), a group protested against the installation of the second UPM's factory in the country, during a celebration of the Day of the Declaration of Independence in Piedra Alta, with President Lacalle Pou's presence. [size=no report]
FENAPES: Federation of High schools Teachers Union; Teachers (Uruguay)

On 18 August 2020, in Tacuarembo (Tacuarembo), members of FENAPES (Federation of High schools Teachers Union) gathered in 19 de Abril Square to read a proclamation and complain about the cuts in the education budget. [size=no report]

On 17 August 2020, in Punta del Este (Maldonado), Argentineans living in Uruguay joined the Argentine's national protest against the extension of the social isolation due to the coronavirus pandemic, release of prisoners accused of corruption during the Kirchners administrations, the judicial reform promoted by the government and expropriation of private property. The protest was convened by anti-government groups. [size=no report]

On 14 August 2020, in Montevideo-Municipio B (Montevideo), a group of students marched through the streets during the Student Martyrs' Day (Dia de los Martires Estudiantiles) in a protest asking for more investments in science and technology. [size=no report]

Around 10 August 2020 (as reported), in Montevideo-Municipio B (Montevideo), nursing assistants and professionals protested in front of the Executive Tower to demand a reduction in their working hours. They pointed out that they have only a few hours to rest and that this was aggravated by the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]
PIT-CNT: Intersindical Workers' Plenary - National Workers' Convention; Labour Group (Uruguay)

Around 31 July 2020, around Montevideo-Municipio B (Montevideo), thousands of unionists, including members of PIT-CNT (Intersindical Workers' Plenary - National Workers' Convention), marched from Artigas Square towards Treinta y Tres Square to demand greater budget, basic emergency income, salary increase for civil servants and rejection of the Urgent Consideration Bill (LUC). [size=thousands]

On 27 July 2020, in Montevideo-Municipio A (Montevideo), around 300 people, including friends and relatives, blocked Carlos Maria Ramirez Avenue and demonstrated to demand justice for two teenagers who were killed in La Teja neighborhood on the day before. They set tires on fire. [size=around 300]
PIT-CNT: Intersindical Workers' Plenary - National Workers' Convention; Labour Group (Uruguay)

On 4 June 2020, in Montevideo-Municipio B (Montevideo), hundreds of people, led by PIT-CNT (Intersindical Workers' Plenary - National Workers' Convention), protested in Libertador Avenue in defense of the citizen's health (under the context of the coronavirus pandemic) and against the Urgent Consideration Bill (LUC). [size=hundreds]
On 21 May 2020, in San Luis (Canelones), a group of residents blocked km 62 of Interbalnearia route to demand more security, after an increase in burglaries in the area. [size=no report]
PIT-CNT: Intersindical Workers' Plenary - National Workers' Convention; Labour Group (Uruguay)

On 20 May 2020, in Montevideo-Municipio Ch (Montevideo), PIT-CNT (Intersindical Workers' Plenary - National Workers' Convention) gathered in Artigas Square in order to march towards Treinta y Tres Square to demand labor and wage guarantees for workers. [size=no report]
SUNCA: Single National Union of Construction and Annexes; Labour Group (Uruguay)

On 19 May 2020, in Tacuarembo (Tacuarembo), members of SUNCA (Single National Union of Construction and Annexes) protested in El Hongo neighborhood to demand workers' rights, wage increase, among other issues. The group also was against the Urgent Consideration Bill (LUC) and stated against employer's abuse during the coronavirus pandemic. SUNCA carried out a strike in the whole country. [size=no report]

On 14 May 2020, in Montevideo-Municipio B (Montevideo), hundreds of people gathered in front of the Legislative Palace to protest against the Urgent Consideration Bill (LUC). The Vice President and the President of the Chamber of Representatives claimed that they offered the protesters a meeting, so they could present a proposal to the Parliament, but the group did not accept it. The Urgent Consideration Bill (LUC) was submitted to the Parliament by president Lacalle Pou (National Party) and it is about a series of different national subjects. [size=hundreds]
PIT-CNT: Intersindical Workers' Plenary - National Workers' Convention; Labour Group (Uruguay)

On 1 May 2020, around Montevideo-Municipio B (Montevideo), tens of thousands of vehicles carried out a motorcade, led by PIT-CNT (Inter-Union Workers' Plenary - National Workers' Convention), to celebrate Labor's day and demand dialogue between the authorities and workers, due to the crisis caused by the coronavirus pandemic and the suggested social isolation in Uruguay. [size=tens of thousands]

On 1 April 2020, in Montevideo-Municipio B (Montevideo), fruit sellers and shopkeepers protested in front of the Executive Tower to complain about the economic situation. The event took place during the coronavirus pandemic, when a mandatory social isolation was established across the country. [size=no report]

On 28 March 2020, in Punta del Diablo (Rocha), around 20 residents blocked the city's entrance with their cars, so tourists would not get in. The main goal of this measure was to prevent the spread of coronavirus, that was considered pandemic by the World Health Organization.
PIT-CNT: Intersindical Workers' Plenary - National Workers' Convention; Labour Group (Uruguay)

On 25 March 2020, in Montevideo municipality, PIT-CNT (Intersindical Workers' Plenary - National Workers' Convention) performed a pot banging protest to complain about the lack of action of the authorities to mitigate the economic impact of the health emergency caused by the coronavirus pandemic, which was decreed on 13 March 2020. [size=no report]
FA: Broad Front; Government of Uruguay (2020-)

On 22 March 2020, in Montevideo municipality, some residents performed a pot banging to demand the government to decree the mandatory quarantine to contain the spread of the coronavirus pandemic. The group also protested against the adjustment of rates. Members of FA (Broad Front), including congressmen, supported this protest. [size=no report]
On 8 March 2020, in Salto (Salto), dozens of women marched in the North coast to demand women's rights and the end of gender violence on the International Women's Day. [size=dozens]
On 8 March 2020, in Maldonado (Maldonado), a group of women marched to demand women's rights and the end of gender violence on the International Women's Day. [size=no report]
On 8 March 2020, in Soriano deparment, a group of women marched to demand women's rights and the end of gender violence on the International Women's Day. [size=no report]
Women (Uruguay); PN: National Party; Government of Uruguay (2020-)

On 8 March 2020, in Montevideo-Municipio B (Montevideo), thousands of women gathered in Cagancha Square, and on the esplanade of the University of the Republic, to demand women's rights and the end of gender violence on the International Women's Day march. The vice-president Argimon (PN: National Party) joined the protest. [size=thousands]
On 8 March 2020, in Paysandu (Paysandu), a group of women marched to demand women's rights and the end of gender violence on the International Women's Day. [size=no report]
On 8 March 2020, in Rocha (Rocha), a group of women marched to demand women's rights and the end of gender violence on the International Women's Day. [size=no report]
On 8 March 2020, in San Jose de Mayo (San Jose), a group of women marched to demand women's rights and the end of gender violence on the International Women's Day. [size=no report]
On 8 March 2020, in Tacuarembo (Tacuarembo), a group of women marched to demand women's rights and the end of gender violence on the International Women's Day. [size=no report]
On 8 March 2020, in Durazno (Durazno), a group of women marched to demand women's rights and the end of gender violence on the International Women's Day. [size=no report]

On 1 March 2020, in Montevideo-Municipio B (Montevideo), Luis Lacalle Pou of the PN (National Party) took over the presidency of Uruguay in the Legislative Palace in Montevideo, ending 15 years of the leftist government of the Broad Front (FA).

On 31 January 2020, in Montevideo-Municipio Ch (Montevideo), members of the interdepartmental bus workers union blocked the entry and exit of cars in Tres Cruces bus terminal. The group aimed to solve the situation between workers and the company (Nossar) after the dismissal of the Union's president. [size=no report]

On 18 January 2020, in Punta del Este (Maldonado), a group of Argentineans gathered in Playa Brava to march in honor of prosecutor Alberto Nisman (who was found dead in his house in 2015, one day before sharing his findings in the investigation of the 1994 bomb attack in the Israel's embassy) on the fifth anniversary of his death. [size=no report]
Labour Group (Uruguay); Former Police Forces of Uruguay (2005-2020); Police Forces of Uruguay (2005-2020)

On 16 January 2020, in Salto city (Salto), locals, union groups, police officers and retired officers staged a protest in Plaza Artigas to demand justice after the killing of a police officer on 15 January. The group demanded more severe laws to improve security. [size=no report]
On 10 January 2020, in Salto (Salto), a petrol bomb was thrown at a farm in the early hours. A person heard the noise and quickly put out the fire. Authors and the motivations are unknown.

On 2 January 2020, in Montevideo - Municipio B (Montevideo), the group Women in Black gathered in the City Hall in a protest to repudiate gender violence, after the murder of three women during Christmas. After these three deaths, president Vazquez decreed national emergency for gender violence. [size=no report]
Party of the People; Government of Uruguay (2005-2020); Women (Uruguay)

On 11 December 2019, in Salto (Salto), the house of a female town councillor from the Party of the People was shot after a group of people gathered in front of her house to verbally assault her. During this situation, a man shot at her house two times. No injuries.

On 1 December 2019, in Montevideo - Municipio Ch (Montevideo), at least 17 people set fire to a pickup truck and threw rocks at cars and houses in the Kibon area. Seventeen people were arrested. [size=at least 17]

On 25 November 2019, in Salto (Salto), a group of women protested for women's rights and against femicide and gender violence, under the International Day for the Elimination of Violence against Women. [size=no reported]
Women (Uruguay); FA: Broad Front; PN: National Party

On 25 November 2019, in Montevideo - Municipio A (Montevideo), a group of women protested for women's rights and against femicide and gender violence, under the International Day for the Elimination of Violence against Women. The vice candidates of FA (Broad Front) and PN (National Party) in the last elections joined the protest. [size=no report]
On 24 November 2019, In Uruguay, the centre-right National Party candidate, Luis Lacalle Pou, won the presidential elections.
PIT-CNT: Intersindical Workers' Plenary - National Workers' Convention; Labour Group (Uruguay)

On 14 November 2019, in Montevideo - Municipio B (Montevideo), hundreds of people gathered in Libertad Square to protestin support of former Bolivian president Evo Morales, who resigned following a political crisis. The protest was organized by PIT-CNT. [size=hundreds]

On 12 November 2019, in Montevideo - Municipio B (Montevideo), a group protested in front of the Uruguayan Soccer Association (UAF), carrying Palestinian flags, they demanded that the national team would not play in Israel. The Uruguay versus Argentina match was scheduled to 18 November 2019 in Tel Aviv. [size=no report]

On 25 October 2019, in Montevideo - Municipio B, Montevideo, citizens of the sector staged a demonstration in the entrances of Banco Republica in 18 de Julio street and Mallaganes. They demonstrated against second cellulose plant of UPM installation. Hooded people made graffitis in the headquarters of the Republic Bank and threw ink bombs. [size=no report]

As reported on 22 October 2019, in Montevideo's District B (Montevideo), demonstrators gathered in protest in front of the University of the Republic against the constitutional reform 'Vivir sin miedo' or 'Living without fear'. [size=no report]

On 5 September 2019, in Municipio B, Montevideo, riots broke-out when a unit of police forces clashed with a group of 50 masked demonstrators damaging private property. The group demonstrated against the construction of a pulp factory in the country. Two people were injured with buckshot. Four people were arrested. [size=50]
On 05 September 2019, in Montevideo, farmers and peasants members of the social movement USU protested against the high unemployment rates in the rural areas of the country. [size=no report]
On 04 September 2019, on Tacuarembo, Tacuarembo department, around thirty people protested to demand justice in a case of gender and sexual violence in the district. [size=around thirty]
On July 29, 2019, a group of workers of the local hospital of Punta del Este, Maldonado department, protested to demand justice in the case of a colleague killed on previous days. [size=no report]

On July 27, 2019, prisoners demonstrated in the prison of Cerro Carancho, near Rivera, against the transfer of a convict accused of child abuse. The group set objects on fire and threatened the recently arrived inmate. [size=no report]

As reported on July 21, 2019, a resident of Paysandu killed a rioter with a shotgun in self-defense when a small group attacked his house with rocks and other objects. The victim was unarmed at the moment of the event.
Around 20 July 2019 (as reported), members of the Military Forces of Uruguay were accused of sexually assaulting a 17-year-old woman in the city of Durazno.

As reported on July 16, a group of at least 100 dairy farmers staged a protest in Municipio E, Montevideo, against a debt owed by the Venezuelan state. The group demands the national government to take measures to cover the payments. [size=at least 100]
On July 9, 2019, in the city of Paysandu, Paysandu department a group of citizens and women organizations protested against a case of gender violence. [size=no report]

On July 5, 2019, a group of workers of the leather industry protested near the residency of the Uruguayan president located in the municipality C of the city of Montevideo. The group protested against the potential shutting down of a local factory. [size=no report]

Around 19 June 2019, in Joaquin Suarez, Canelones, the director of the National Institute of Adolescent Social Inclusion was killed and his body found. The victim was shot several times. No group has claimed the event.

In the week of June 17, 2019, a group of citizens demonstrated in front of the National Court in Montevideo in support to a court ruling that allowed a single dad to have parental leave from his job. [size=no report]
PIT-CNT: Intersindical Workers' Plenary - National Workers' Convention; Labour Group (Uruguay)

In the week of May 28, 2019, protested against the dismissal of several workers of a petroleum company continued in the city of Montevideo. The group, affiliated to PIT-CNT union, claims that more than 60.000 job places are potentially being reduced due to new regulation. [size=no report]

In the week of May 28, 2019, a group of students protested in a high school in the city of Montevideo. The group demonstrated because the school's administration decided to remove ads with political propaganda from one of the school's facilities. The group claimed that their political participation is being jeopardized. [size=no report]
PIT-CNT: Intersindical Workers' Plenary - National Workers' Convention; Labour Group (Uruguay); FENAPES: Federation of High schools Teachers Union; Teachers (Uruguay)

On May 22, 2019, workers, teachers, members of the PIT-CNT union, and FENAPES protested in the city of Montevideo. The group demonstrated in support of gas workers, which are in a strike for new regulations in their work conditions. [size=no report]
On May 18, 2019, citizens marched in the city of Montevideo. The group demonstrated demanding justice in the cases of forced disappeared people during the military dictatorship. [size=no report]

In the week of May 17, 2019, in the middle of a demonstration, a group of rioters attacked the building of the Development Bank of Latin America in the city of Montevideo in Uruguay. The group threw several Molotov bombs and painted the main entrance of the facilities. [size=no report]
On May 13, 2019, a group of citizens protested in the city of Salto in the Salto department. The group claimed for justice in the case of a businessman killed during 2018. [size=no report]

On May 9, 2019, public attorneys protested in the city of Montevideo. The group claims for a significant increased in their work due to a new penal law was enacted in 2017. The event was triggered for the death of a colleague in one of the public offices. The woman was diagnosed with stress symptoms. [size=no report]

On 25 April 2019, at the MontevideoGas company, Montevideo, Municipio B, employees with the union occupied the buildings in spite of a court order prohibiting the action. Employees took control in response to restructuring with another company. [size=no report]

On 21 April 2019, in La Capuera, Maldonado, a man accused of theft was attacked by residents, beaten, and tied up on a post before they called police. The victim denied all accusations of being a thief. [size=no report]
On 11 April 2019, in the centre of Montevideo, Municipio B, thousands of people gathered in protest to demand justice for crimes committed during the dictatorship. [size=thousands]
On 28 March 2019, in Rodriguez, San Jose, a demonstration took place to draw attention to a case of a woman who went missing after an argument with her partner. [size=no report]

On 28 March 2019, at the University of the Republic's Faculty of Medicine, Montevideo, Municipio C, about 70 people gathered five months after the murder of a medical student. Friends and family of the victim participated demanding justice for the victim. [size=about 70]

On 20 March 2019, in Jacinto Vera, Montevideo, Municipio C, a group of hooded individuals threw a Molotov bomb at a church. The parish door caught on fire but was controlled by the fire department. [size=no report]

On 9 March 2019, in Cordon, Montevideo, Municipio B, during a demonstration on the International Day of the Women, a group broke out and vandalised a church throwing ink bombs and yelling that the church was the dictatorship. [size=no report]

On 8 March 2019, in the centre of Montevideo, Municipio B, thousands of people marched for the International Day of the Woman, demanding the change of power balance and inequality of women. [size=thousands]
On February 27 2019, workers of a company protested by taking the company in Melo. The main purpose of the peaceful takeover was to re-incorporate 30 workers. [size=no report]
On February 24 2019, over 100 labour group members protested demanding that a 2% interest rate to be fixed in housing cooperatives. The protested happened in Punta del Este. [size=over 100]
On 16 February 2019, in Punta Gorda, Montevideo, a street artist was found dead, having been shot in the head. The artist was known for painting art promoting a communist candidate (PCU).

As reported on 30 January 2019, a clash erupted between prisoners from the Santiago Vazquez prison in Santiago Vazquez village (Municipio A, Montevideo). As a result, multiple prisoners were injured, but none severely. [size=no report]

On 24 January 2019, public servants from the General Tax Directorate (DGI) took over the headquarters of the DGI in Maldonado city (Maldonado, Maldonado) to demand a negotiating table to guarantee no salary cuts for the DGI workers. [size=no report]

On 23 January 2019, hundreds of Venezuelan citizens staged a protest at Plaza de la Bandera, in Montevideo city (Municipio B, Montevideo), in support to the Venezuelan opposition leader Juan Guaido and in rejection to the beginning of a new term under the government of Nicolas Maduro. [size=100]

On 21 January 2019, 2 men and 1 woman vandalized the facilities of the Pasteur Hospital, in Montevideo city (Municipio B, Montevideo), threatening the people inside the hospital, as a reaction to the death of one of their brothers, who had had a car crash while he was being chased by the police forces for allegedly having stolen a motorbike. [size=3]

On 16 January 2019, in Municipio B, Montevideo, police forces arrested the alleged leader of a criminal gang during the funeral of his son. Relatives of the arrested man clashed with the police forces, throwing objects at them. According to the relatives, the police forces forcibly entered the room and beat some of the people present. [size=no report]

On 8 January 2019, public servants from the General Tax Directorate (DGI) staged a protest in Punta del Este city (Punta del Este, Maldonado) to demand a negotiating table to guarantee no salary cuts for the DGI workers. [size=no report]
On 21 December 2018, near Montevideo, workers at a gas company protested by blocking the entrance and exit of trucks because of the dismissal of a coworker. [size=no report]

On 11 December 2018, a protest was held by workers at the Tax Administration of the Ministry of Economy took place, in Municipio B. They occupied the building and stopped activity. They were forced to evacuate. [size=no report]
On 7 December 2018, in Motevideo, workers at the laboratory Problab protested the dismissal of one of their co-workers and blocked the entrance to the laboratory. [size=no report]

On 21 November 2018, the Department of Humanities of the University in Montevideo, Municipio B was vandalized, messages against the patriarchy, and the police were written with spray paint, and the entrance to building was blocked with furniture.

On 2 November 2018, a group of 135 prisoners of the Santiago Vazquez Penitentiary Complex, in Municipio A, Montevideo, started a riot that included setting mattresses on fire and vandalizing the building. The Minister of Interior informed that there was no actual clash between the prisoners and the officers and no injuries, and that they regained control of the situation.

On 31 October 2018, in Montevideo, around 50 people marched from the Square Pedro Fabini, Municipio B, towards the Supreme Court of Justice to demand justice for the death of child at a children's party 2 years ago. [size=around 50]

On 29 October 2018, in Montevideo, medicine students marched to ask for justice for the death of the medical student who was killed on Oct 21st. The students marched at Avenida Italia in Montevideo towards the Hospital Clinics. [size=no report]

On 25 October 2018, in Montevideo, Montevideo, a group of around 50 Cuban immigrants protested at the council to speed up the process to get working and ID documents. After some pressure they were told that they will get their documents on Thursday. [size=around 50]

On 19 October 2018, a group of 10 workers members of a union blocked the arrivals and departures from the Terminal Tres Cruces in Montevideo, Municipio B, affecting the travel plans of around 45,000 civilians. Some of the transport companies reported that their cars/buses were attacked with rocks.

On 15 October 2018, in Toledo, Canelones, around 200 neighbours and business owners from the city of Toledo protested for the insecurity and violence. Particularly in response to the robbery and murder of a shop owner on Sat. 13th. [size=around 200]

On 12 October 2018, in Canelones, Canelones, hundreds of neighbours protested in front of the police office, to defend a shop-owner who shot a robber and killed him. The protesters claimed that they're tired of the violence and robberies in the city. [size=hundreds]

On 28 September 2018, in Montevideo-Municipio B, Montevideo, thousands of people protested in the March for Diversity in support of LGBT rights. Many individuals wore yellow and red handkerchiefs demanding the approval of the so called trans law. [size=thousands]

On 17 September 2018, in Montevideo-Municipio G, Montevideo, truck drivers blocked the entrance to the main fuel distribution center of the city, the La Tablada plant. The group protested over their work conditions and the fact that they have to drive for more than one day with no sleep. [size=no report]
On 8 August 2018, in Montevideo, a protest took place at the Hospital Pereira Rossell, Municipio B, because of the of a nurse on 4 August. [size=no report]

On 9 July 2018, in Treinta y Tres, Treinta y Tres, a dozen of residents marched in a protest over the violent death of a man and a woman. They carried signs demanding justice and the resolution of the cases. [size=a dozen]

On 19 June 2018, hundreds of people from the neighbourhood El Prado, Municipio B, in Montevideo protested outside the president's house because of the murder of a young man, who was killed in the area. [size=hundreds]

On 17 June 2018, in Montevideo, students members of the Instituto de Profesores Artigas (IPA), Municipio B, occupied the building of the school in protest for an increase in the budget. [size=no report]

On 14 June 2018, in Montevideo, three unions of the University of the Republic (UdelaR) - teachers, students, and staff - marched in protest for an increase of budget in the street July 18th towards the Executive Tower in Montevideo, Municipio B. [size=no report]

On 11 June 2018, in Rodriguez, San Jose, a protest from the group Un Solo Uruguay took place on the route 1 in the department of San Jose. The movement demands the better use of public money and the increased cost of oil. [size=no report]

On 9 June 2018, in Canelones - neighbours from Pinamar, Neptunia and Salinas - blocked the route Interbalnearia in front of the local office of Pinamar, as protest for the insecurity and violence that they live in the area.
On 20 May 2018, in Montevideo, there was a protest outside the Embassy of Venezuela, in Municipio B, in in opposition to the Government.
On 24 April 2018, in Ituzaingo, San Jose, relatives of two men who were killed in Piedras Blancas, blocked the crossover between the streets Aparicio Saravia an Instrucciones. [size=no report]

On 16 April 2018, in Ciudad Vieja, Municipio B, Montevideo, craft workers protested for their right to sell their crafts in the street without being considered street-sellers. The protest had been going on for a few days. [size=no report]
On 23 March 2018, thousands of people from San Carlos marched in protest against the current security issues.
On 14 March 2018, Montevideo, farmers, drivers and sellers protested against the increase of oil prices.
On 8 March 2018, in the context of the march for women's day a Church was vandalized by rioters Montevideo.
On 23 January 2018, in Durazno, thousands of farmers, traders, and transportation workers took to the streets to demand the government to lower taxes. [size=thousands]
On 23 January 2018, in Montevideo, scores of local inhabitants took to the streets in Municipio B to demand the government to improve the profitability of the rural sector. [size=no report]
On 15 January 2018, farmers, traders and transportation workers took to the streets in Paysandu city (Paysandu) to demand the government to lower taxes. [size=no report]
On 15 January 2018, hundreds of farmers, traders and transportation workers took to the streets in Colonia del Sacramento city (Colonia) to demand the government to lower taxes. [size=100]
On 15 January 2018, farmers, traders and transportation workers took to the streets in the Soriano department to demand the government to lower taxes. [size=no report]
On 15 January 2018, farmers, traders and transportation workers took to the streets in Rocha city (Rocha) to demand the government to lower taxes. [size=no report]

bites.title: Top 10 of assoc_actor_1 by count
bite: PIT-CNT: Intersindical Workers' Plenary - National Workers' Convention; Labour Group (Uruguay)

bites.title: Top 10 of assoc_actor_2 by count
bite: Party of the People; Government of Uruguay (2005-2020); Women (Uruguay)

bites.title: Top 10 of assoc_actor_1 by fatalities
bite: PIT-CNT: Intersindical Workers' Plenary - National Workers' Convention; Labour Group (Uruguay)

bites.title: Top 10 of assoc_actor_2 by fatalities
bite: Party of the People; Government of Uruguay (2005-2020); Women (Uruguay)

bites.bite: The largest admin1 is Montevideo with 72 reports followed by Maldonado with 10 reports.
The largest admin2 is Municipio B with 52 reports followed by Salto with 9 reports.
The largest admin1 is Montevideo with 72 reports followed by Maldonado with 10 reports.
